instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message:
Board came in with no power, clean board overall but some corrosion under <CHIP>U5580</CHIP>, that got fixed but still no power, raballed SMC, computer booted up once but keyboard and trackpad had some issues, keyboard only power button worked and trackpad only the click worked. After shutting down now the Mac gets fan spin but there is no chime and system doesn't load, the external USB activity light turns on but there is no blinking. 

Any suggestions will be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message:
Fan shouldn't spin at the begining, unless starts in SMC bypass mode.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> level, try disconnecting keyboard too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message: Yes sorry forgot to mention that, fan spin starts when CPU gets hot, on this board I know this is normal, I did try without keyboard and also without keyboard and trackpad, same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message:
I said to check <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> thinking the board may start in SMC bypass, because of keyboard issue.
This will cause fan spinning at start.
Nex time, try to describe more exactly the symptoms...

Did you try SMC bypass mode?
Test the board alone on the desk; use only USB device for test.
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and all their traces.
Try known good BIOS, just in case; do NOT forget to make backup fiest!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message: SMC bypass nothing happens, SPI resistors good, I will hunt the BIOS and try, out of the time I invested on this one today it did start once but after that not any more, I looked for corrosion very slowly under max scope elsewhere and found nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message: Found a couple good BIOS, tried both, same thing, at all times one thing that is steady is ppbus at 12.59v, I checked all power rails and not shorts found

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message:
Something more affected by corrosion.
Try to heat BGA chips with quality flux, then pass the board to UC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message: Thanks a lot, I did as suggested, and same thing, board tries but no activity on external boot drive and of course no image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message: So board stays on, with all volatges, but no activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin but no chime and no system load
threads.message: Sorry customer was too intense on this board, gave it back at no charge of course.
